enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_8
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 8 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_9
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

field.name: MSTSCLHIGH
field.description: Master SCL High time. Specifies the minimum high time that will be asserted by this master on SCL. Other masters in a multi-master system could shorten this time. This corresponds to the parameter tHIGH in the I2C bus specification. I2C bus specification parameters tSU;STO and tHD;STA have the same values and are also controlled by MSTSCLHIGH.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 2 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_3
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 3 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider .

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 4 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_5
enumeratedValue.description: 5 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 5 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_6
enumeratedValue.description: 6 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 6 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_7
enumeratedValue.description: 7 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 7 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_8
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 8 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_9
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

register.name: MSTDAT
register.description: Combined Master receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Master function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Master function. Write: transmit data using the Master function.

enumeratedValue.name: Continue
enumeratedValue.description: Informs the Slave function to continue to the next operation.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK
enumeratedValue.description: NACK. Causes the Slave function to NACK the master when the slave is receiving data from the master (Slave Receiver mode).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No DMA requests are issued for Slave mode operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. DMA requests are issued for I2C slave data transmission and reception.

register.name: SLVDAT
register.description: Combined Slave receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Slave function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Slave function. Write: transmit data using the Slave function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Slave Address n is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Ignored Slave Address n is ignored.

field.name: SLVADR
field.description: Slave Address. Seven bit slave address that is compared to received addresses if enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MASK
enumeratedValue.description: Mask. The SLVQUAL0 field is used as a logical mask for matching address 0.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTEND
enumeratedValue.description: Extend. The SLVQUAL0 field is used to extend address 0 matching in a range of addresses.

field.name: SLVQUAL0
field.description: Slave address Qualifier for address 0. A value of 0 causes the address in SLVADR0 to be used as-is, assuming that it is enabled. If QUALMODE0 = 0, any bit in this field which is set to 1 will cause an automatic match of the corresponding bit of the received address when it is compared to the SLVADR0 register. If QUALMODE0 = 1, an address range is matched for address 0. This range extends from the value defined by SLVADR0 to the address defined by SLVQUAL0 (address matches when SLVADR0[7:1] <= received address <= SLVQUAL0[7:1]).

field.name: MONRXDAT
field.description: Monitor function Receiver Data. This reflects every data byte that passes on the I2C pins.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_START_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: No start detected. The Monitor function has not detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: START_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Start detected. The Monitor function has detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: No repeated start detected. The Monitor function has not detected a Repeated Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Repeated start detected. The Monitor function has detected a Repeated Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the Monitor function was acknowledged by at least one master or slave receiver.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the Monitor function was not acknowledged by any receiver.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SPI is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SPI is enabled for operation.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave mode. The SPI will operate in slave mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are inputs, MISO is an output.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Master mode. The SPI will operate in master mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are outputs, MISO is an input.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. Data is transmitted and received in standard MSB first order.

enumeratedValue.name: REVERSE
enumeratedValue.description: Reverse. Data is transmitted and received in reverse order (LSB first).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: Change. The SPI captures serial data on the first clock transition of the transfer (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is changed on the following edge.

enumeratedValue.name: CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: Capture. The SPI changes serial data on the first clock transition of the transfer (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is captured on the following edge.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The rest state of the clock (between transfers) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The rest state of the clock (between transfers) is high.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Loopback mode enable. Loopback mode applies only to Master mode, and connects transmit and receive data connected together to allow simple software testing.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL0 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL0 pin is active high.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL1 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL1 pin is active high.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL2 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL2 pin is active high.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL3 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL3 pin is active high.

field.name: PRE_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between SSEL assertion and the beginning of a data transfer. There is always one SPI clock time between SSEL assertion and the first clock edge. This is not considered part of the pre-delay. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: POST_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between the end of a data transfer and SSEL deassertion. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: FRAME_DELAY
field.description: If the EOF flag is set, controls the minimum amount of time between the current frame and the next frame (or SSEL deassertion if EOT). 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: TRANSFER_DELAY
field.description: Controls the minimum amount of time that the SSEL is deasserted between transfers. 0x0 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 1 SPI clock time. (Zero added time.) 0x1 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 2 SPI clock times. 0x2 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 3 SPI clock times. 0xF = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 16 SPI clock times.

register.name: STAT
register.description: SPI Status. Some status flags can be cleared by writing a 1 to that bit position

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT or TXDATCTL until the data is moved to the transmit shift register.

field.name: RXOV
field.description: Receiver Overrun interrupt flag. This flag applies only to slave mode (Master = 0). This flag is set when the beginning of a received character is detected while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the receiver buffer contents are preserved, and the incoming data is lost. Data received by the SPI should be considered undefined if RxOv is set.

field.name: TXUR
field.description: Transmitter Underrun interrupt flag. This flag applies only to slave mode (Master = 0). In this case, the transmitter must begin sending new data on the next input clock if the transmitter is idle. If that data is not available in the transmitter holding register at that point, there is no data to transmit and the TXUR flag is set. Data transmitted by the SPI should be considered undefined if TXUR is set.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert. This flag is set whenever any slave select transitions from deasserted to asserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become busy, and allows waking up the device from reduced power modes when a slave mode access begins. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert. This flag is set whenever any asserted slave selects transition to deasserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become idle. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: STALLED
field.description: Stalled status flag. This indicates whether the SPI is currently in a stall condition.

field.name: ENDTRANSFER
field.description: End Transfer control bit. Software can set this bit to force an end to the current transfer when the transmitter finishes any activity already in progress, as if the EOT flag had been set prior to the last transmission. This capability is included to support cases where it is not known when transmit data is written that it will be the end of a transfer. The bit is cleared when the transmitter becomes idle as the transfer comes to an end. Forcing an end of transfer in this manner causes any specified FRAME_DELAY and TRANSFER_DELAY to be inserted.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Master idle status flag. This bit is 1 whenever the SPI master function is fully idle. This means that the transmit holding register is empty and the transmitter is not in the process of sending data.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable read and Set. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: RXRDYEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: RXRDYEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available in the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRDYEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRDYEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when data may be written to TXDAT.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a receiver overrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need for the receiver to move newly received data to the RXDAT register when it is already in use. The interface prevents receiver overrun in Master mode by not allowing a new transmission to begin when a receiver overrun would otherwise occur.

enumeratedValue.name: RXOVEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when a receiver overrun occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: RXOVEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated if a receiver overrun occurs.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a transmitter underrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need to transmit data when none is available.

enumeratedValue.name: TXUREN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter underruns.

enumeratedValue.name: TXUREN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated if the transmitter underruns.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSAEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSAEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSDEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSDEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable Clear. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit in INTENSET to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: Receiver Data. This contains the next piece of received data. The number of bits that are used depends on the LEN setting in TXCTL / TXDATCTL.

field.name: RXSSEL0_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL0 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL0 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL1_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL1 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL1 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL2_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL2 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL2 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL3_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL3 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL3 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: SOT
field.description: Start of Transfer flag. This flag will be 1 if this is the first data after the SSELs went from deasserted to asserted (i.e., any previous transfer has ended). This information can be used to identify the first piece of data in cases where the transfer length is greater than 16 bit.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 1 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: TXSSEL0_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL0 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL0 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL1_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL1 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL1 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL2_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL2 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL2 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL3_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL3 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL3 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer. The asserted SSEL will be deasserted at the end of a transfer, and remain so for at least the time specified by the Transfer_delay value in the DLY register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_deasserted
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data is not treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will not be deasserted at the end of this data.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_not_deasserted
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data is treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will be deasserted at the end of this piece of data.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame. Between frames, a delay may be inserted, as defined by the FRAME_DELAY value in the DLY register. The end of a frame may not be particularly meaningful if the FRAME_DELAY value = 0. This control can be used as part of the support for frame lengths greater than 16 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: Data_not_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data transmitted is not treated as the end of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: Data_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data is treated as the end of a frame, causing the FRAME_DELAY time to be inserted before subsequent data is transmitted.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore. This allows data to be transmitted using the SPI without the need to read unneeded data from the receiver.Setting this bit simplifies the transmit process and can be used with the DMA.

enumeratedValue.name: Read_received_data
enumeratedValue.description: Received data must be read in order to allow transmission to progress. In slave mode, an overrun error will occur if received data is not read before new data is received.

enumeratedValue.name: Ignore_received_data
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is ignored, allowing transmission without reading unneeded received data. No receiver flags are generated.

field.name: LEN
field.description: Data Length. Specifies the data length from 1 to 16 bits. Note that transfer lengths greater than 16 bits are supported by implementing multiple sequential transmits. 0x0 = Data transfer is 1 bit in length. 0x1 = Data transfer is 2 bits in length. 0x2 = Data transfer is 3 bits in length. ... 0xF = Data transfer is 16 bits in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 1 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_2
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 2 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_3
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 3 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_4
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 4 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_5
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 5 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_6
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 6 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_7
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 7 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_8
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 8 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_9
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 9 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_10
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 10 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_11
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 11 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_12
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 12 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_13
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 13 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_14
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 14 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_15
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 15 bit in length.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 4 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: Rate divider value. Specifies how the Flexcomm clock (FCLK) is divided to produce the SPI clock rate in master mode. DIVVAL is -1 encoded such that the value 0 results in FCLK/1, the value 1 results in FCLK/2, up to the maximum possible divide value of 0xFFFF, which results in FCLK/65536.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_OFF
enumeratedValue.description: MASTER_OFF: Master is off (is not enabled). If MASTER_OFF is enabled, then the I3C module can only use slave mode.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_ON
enumeratedValue.description: MASTER_ON: Master is on (is enabled). When used from start-up, this I3C module is master by default (the main master). The module will control the bus unless the master is handed off. If the master is handed off, then MSTENA must move to 2 after that happens. The handoff means emitting GETACCMST and if accepted, the module will emit a STOP and set the MSTENA bit to 2 (or 0).

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_CAPABLE
enumeratedValue.description: MASTER_CAPABLE: The I3C module is master-capable; however the module is operating as a slave now. When used from the start, the I3C module will start as a slave, but will be prepared to switch to master mode. To switch to master mode, the slave emits an Master Request (MR), or gets a GETACCMST CCC command and accepts it (to switch on the STOP).

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: NONE: Use PUR (Pull-Up Resistor). Hold SCL High.

enumeratedValue.name: WIRED_IN
enumeratedValue.description: WIRED_IN: Wired-in High Keeper controls; use pin_HK (High Keeper) controls.

enumeratedValue.name: PASSIVE_SDA
enumeratedValue.description: PASSIVE_SDA: Passive on SDA; can Hi-Z (high impedance) for Bus Free (IDLE) and hold.

enumeratedValue.name: PASSIVE_ON_SDA_SCL
enumeratedValue.description: PASSIVE_ON_SDA_SCL: Passive on SDA and SCL; can Hi-Z (high impedance) both for Bus Free (IDLE), and can Hi-Z SDA for hold.

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: NONE: no event or no pending event

enumeratedValue.name: NO_REQUEST
enumeratedValue.description: NO_REQUEST: Request not sent yet. Either there was no START yet, or is waiting for Bus-Available or Bus-Idle (HJ).

enumeratedValue.name: NACKED
enumeratedValue.description: NACKED: Not acknowledged(Request sent and NACKed); the module will try again.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKED
enumeratedValue.description: ACKED: Acknowledged (Request sent and ACKed), so Done (unless the time control data is still being sent).

field.name: ACTSTATE
field.description: Activity state from Common Command Codes (CCC)

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIME_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: NO_TIME_CONTROL: No time control is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: ASYNC_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: ASYNC_MODE: Asynchronous standard mode (0) is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: NORMAL_MODE: If EVENT is set to 0 after was a non-0 value, event processing will cancel if the event processing has not yet started; if event processing has already been started, then event processing will not be be cancelled.

enumeratedValue.name: IBI
enumeratedValue.description: IBI: Start an In-Band Interrupt. This will try to push an IBI interrupt onto the I3C bus. If data is associated with the IBI, then the data will be read from the SCTRL.IBIDATA field. If time control is enabled, then this data will also include any time control-related bytes; additionally, the IBIDATA byte will have bit 7 set to 1 automatically (as is required for time control). The IBI interrupt will occur after the 1st (mandatory) IBIDATA, if any.

enumeratedValue.name: HOT_JOIN_REQUEST
enumeratedValue.description: HOT_JOIN_REQUEST: Start a Hot-Join request. A Hot-Join Request should only be used when the device is powered on after the I3C bus is already powered up, or when the device is connected using hot insertion methods (the device is powered up when it is physically inserted onto the powered-up I3C bus). The hot join will wait for Bus Idle, and SCTRL.EVENT=HOT_JOIN_REQUEST must be set before the slave enable (SCONFIG.SLVENA).

field.name: CCC
field.description: Common Command Code (CCC) (that was not handled by I3C module) interrupt enable

field.name: CHANDLED
field.description: Common Command Code (CCC) (that was handled by I3C module) interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_ONE_FRAME
enumeratedValue.description: ENABLE_ONE_FRAME: DMA is enabled for 1 Frame (ended by DMA or terminated). DMATB auto-clears on a STOP or START (see the Match START or STOP bit (SCONFIG.MATCHSS).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: ENABLE: DMA is enabled until turned off. Normally, ENABLE should only be used with Master Message mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALF_WORD
enumeratedValue.description: HALF_WORD: Half word (16 bits). This will make sure that 2 bytes are free/available in the FIFO.

field.name: TXTRIG
field.description: Trigger level for TX FIFO emptiness

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGGRONELESS
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger on 1 less than full or less (Default)

field.name: RXTRIG
field.description: Trigger level for RX FIFO fullness

field.name: DATA
field.description: The data byte to send to the master

field.name: DATA
field.description: The data byte to send to the master

field.name: DATA0
field.description: The 1st byte to send to the master

field.name: DATA1
field.description: The 2nd byte to send to the master

register.name: SWDATAHE
register.description: Slave Write Data Half-word End Register

field.name: DATA0
field.description: The 1st byte to send to the master

field.name: DATA1
field.description: The 2nd byte to send to the master

field.name: LSB
field.description: The 1st byte read from the slave

field.name: MSB
field.description: The 2nd byte read from the slave

field.name: DATA
field.description: The data byte rto send to controller

enumeratedValue.name: HW_BUT
enumeratedValue.description: HW_BUT: in hardware but the I3C module instance handles ID 48b.

enumeratedValue.name: PARTNO
enumeratedValue.description: PARTNO: a part number register (PARTNO) handles ID 48b

enumeratedValue.name: MASTERNOTSUPPORTED
enumeratedValue.description: MASTERNOTSUPPORTED: master capability is not supported.

enumeratedValue.name: STATIC
enumeratedValue.description: STATIC: Static address is fixed in hardware

enumeratedValue.name: HW_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: HW_CONTROL: Hardware controls the static address dynamically (for example, from the pin strap)

enumeratedValue.name: CONFIG
enumeratedValue.description: CONFIG: SCONFIG register supplies the static address

field.name: IBI_MR_HJ
field.description: In-Band Interrupts, Master Requests, Hot Join events

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIME_CONTROL_TYPE
enumeratedValue.description: NO_TIME_CONTROL_TYPE: No time control is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: ATLEAST1_TIME_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: ATLEAST1_TIME_CONTROL: at least one time-control type is supported

enumeratedValue.name: FIFO_2BYTE
enumeratedValue.description: FIFO_2BYTE: 2-byte TX FIFO, the default FIFO transmit value (FIFOTX)

enumeratedValue.name: FIFO_2BYTE
enumeratedValue.description: FIFO_2BYTE: 2 (or 3)-byte RX FIFO, the default FIFO receive value (FIFORX)

enumeratedValue.name: DANOTASSIGNED
enumeratedValue.description: DANOTASSIGNED: a Dynamic Address is not assigned

enumeratedValue.name: DAASSIGNED
enumeratedValue.description: DAASSIGNED: a Dynamic Address is assigned

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: NONE: Returns to this when finished with any request. The MSTATUS register indicates the master's state. See also AutoIBI mode. NONE is only written as 0: when setting RDTERM to 1 (to stop a read in progress) or when setting IBI reponse field (IBIRESP) for MSG use

enumeratedValue.name: EMITSTARTADDR
enumeratedValue.description: EMITSTARTADDR: Emit START with address and direction from a stopped state or in the middle of a Single Data Rate (SDR) message. If from a stopped state (IDLE), then emit start may be prevented by an event (like IBI, MR, HJ), in which case the appropriate interrupt is signaled; note that Emit START can be resubmitted.

enumeratedValue.name: EMITSTOP
enumeratedValue.description: EMITSTOP: Emit a STOP on bus. Must be in Single Data Rate (SDR) mode. If in Dynamic Address Assignment (DAA) mode, Emit stop will exit DAA mode.

enumeratedValue.name: IBIACKNACK
enumeratedValue.description: IBIACKNACK: Manual In-Band Interrupt (IBI) Acknowledge (ACK) or Not Acknowledge (NACK). When IBIRESP has indicated a hold on an In-Band Interrupt to allow a manual decision, this request completes it. Uses IBIRESP to provide the information.

enumeratedValue.name: PROCESSDAA
enumeratedValue.description: PROCESSDAA: If not in Dynamic Address Assignment (DAA) mode now, will issue START, 7E, ENTDAA, and then will emit 7E/R to process each slave. Will stop just before the new Dynamic Address (DA) is to be emitted. The next Process DAA request will use the Addr field as the new DA to assign. If NACKed on the 7E/R, then the interrupt will indicate this situation, and a STOP will be emitted.

enumeratedValue.name: FORCEEXIT
enumeratedValue.description: FORCEEXIT and IBHR: Emit an Exit Pattern from any state, but end Double Data Rate (DDR) (including MSGDDR), if in DDR mode now. Includes a STOP afterward. If TYPE != 0, then it will perform an IBHR (In-Band Hardware Reset). If TYPE=2, then it does a normal reset (DEFRST can prevent the reset). If TYPE=3, it does a forced reset (will always reset).

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOIBI
enumeratedValue.description: AUTOIBI: Hold in a stopped state, but auto-emit START,7E when the slave is holding down SDA to get an In-Band Interrupt (IBI). Actual In-Band Interrupt handling is defined by IBIRESP.

enumeratedValue.name: I3C
enumeratedValue.description: I3C: Normally the SDR mode of I3C. For ForceExit, the Exit pattern.

enumeratedValue.name: I2C
enumeratedValue.description: I2C: Normally the Standard I2C protocol.

enumeratedValue.name: DDR
enumeratedValue.description: DDR: (Double Data Rate): Normally the HDR-DDR mode of I3C. Enter DDR mode (7E and then ENTHDR0), if the module is not already in DDR mode. The 1st byte written to the TX FIFO should be a command, and should already be in the FIFO. To end DDR mode, use ForceExit. For ForceExit, the normal IBHR (In-Band Hardware Reset).

enumeratedValue.name: FORCEDIBHR
enumeratedValue.description: For ForcedExit, this is forced IBHR.

enumeratedValue.name: ACK
enumeratedValue.description: ACK: Acknowledge. A mandatory byte (or not) is decided by the Master In-band Interrupt Registry and Rules Register (MIBIRULES). To limit the maximum number of IBI bytes, configure the Read Termination field (MCTRL.RDTERM).

enumeratedValue.name: ACK_WITH_MANDATORY
enumeratedValue.description: ACK_WITH_MANDATORY: Acknowledge with mandatory byte (ignores the MIBIRULES register). Acknowledge with mandatory byte should not be used, unless only slaves with a mandatory byte can cause an In-Band Interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: MANUAL
enumeratedValue.description: MANUAL: stop and wait for a decision using the IBIAckNack request

enumeratedValue.name: SLVREQ
enumeratedValue.description: SLVREQ: (Slave Request state) the bus has STOPped but a slave is holding SDA low. If using auto-emit IBI (MCTRL.AutoIBI), then the master will not stay in the Slave Request state.

enumeratedValue.name: MSGSDR
enumeratedValue.description: MSGSDR: in Single Data Rate (SDR) Message state (from using MWMSG_SDR)

enumeratedValue.name: NORMACT
enumeratedValue.description: NORMACT: normal active Single Data Rate (SDR) state (from using MCTRL and MWDATAn and MRDATAn registers). The master will stay in the NORMACT state until a STOP is issued.

enumeratedValue.name: DDR
enumeratedValue.description: MSGDDR: in Double Data Rate (DDR) Message mode (from using MWMSG_DDR or using the normal method with DDR). The master will stay in the DDR state, until the master exits using EXIT (emits the Exit pattern).

enumeratedValue.name: DAA
enumeratedValue.description: DAA: in Enter Dynamic Address Assignment (ENTDAA) mode

enumeratedValue.name: IBIACK
enumeratedValue.description: IBIACK: waiting for an In-Band Interrupt (IBI) ACK/NACK decision

enumeratedValue.name: IBIRCV
enumeratedValue.description: IBIRCV: Receiving an In-Band Interrupt (IBI); this IBIRCV state is used after IBI/MR/HJ has won the arbitration, and IBIRCV state is also used for IBI mandatory byte (if any) and any bytes that follow.

field.name: BETWEEN
field.description: Between messages or Dynamic Address Assignments (DAA)

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: NONE: cleared when IBI Won bit (MSTATUS.IBIWON) is cleared

field.name: NOWMASTER
field.description: Now master (now this module is a master)

register.name: MIBIRULES
register.description: Master In-band Interrupt Registry and Rules Register

field.name: MSB0
field.description: Set Most Significant address Bit to 0

field.name: TXNOTFULL
field.description: TX buffer/FIFO is not full interrupt enable

field.name: NOWMASTER
field.description: Now master (now this I3C module is a master) interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_ONE_FRAME
enumeratedValue.description: ENABLE_ONE_FRAME: DMA is enabled for 1 frame. DMAFB auto-clears on STOP or repeated START. See MCONFIG.MATCHSS.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: ENABLE: DMA is enabled until the DMA is turned off.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_ONE_FRAME
enumeratedValue.description: ENABLE_ONE_FRAME: DMA is enabled for 1 frame (ended by DMA or Terminated). DMATB auto-clears on STOP or START. See MCONFIG.MATCHSS.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: ENABLE: DMA is enabled until DMA is turned off. Normally DMA ENABLE should only be used in Master Message mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALF_WORD
enumeratedValue.description: HALF_WORD: Half-word (16 bits). This will make sure that 2 bytes are free/available in FIFO.

register.name: MWDATABE
register.description: Master Write Data Byte End Register

register.name: MWDATAHE
register.description: Master Write Data Byte End Register

register.name: MWMSG_SDR_CONTROL
register.description: Master Write Message in SDR mode

register.name: MWMSG_SDR_DATA
register.description: Master Write Message Data in SDR mode

register.name: MRMSG_SDR
register.description: Master Read Message in SDR mode

register.name: MWMSG_DDR_CONTROL
register.description: Master Write Message in DDR mode

register.name: MWMSG_DDR_DATA
register.description: Master Write Message Data in DDR mode

register.name: MRMSG_DDR
register.description: Master Read Message in DDR mode

register.name: CFG
register.description: USART Configuration register. Basic USART configuration settings that typically are not changed during operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset. While Enable = 0, all USART interrupts and DMA transfers are disabled. When Enable is set again, CFG and most other control bits remain unchanged. When re-enabled, the USART will immediately be ready to transmit because the transmitter has been reset and is therefore available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART is enabled for operation.

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Selects the data size for the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_9
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bit data length. The 9th bit is commonly used for addressing in multidrop mode. See the ADDRDET bit in the CTL register.

field.name: PARITYSEL
field.description: Selects what type of parity is used by the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is even, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be even.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is odd, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be odd.

field.name: STOPLEN
field.description: Number of stop bits appended to transmitted data. Only a single stop bit is required for received data.

enumeratedValue.name: BITS_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits. This setting should only be used for asynchronous communication.

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS Enable. Determines whether CTS is used for flow control. CTS can be from the input pin, or from the USART's own RTS if loopback mode is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No flow control. The transmitter does not receive any automatic flow control signal.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control enabled. The transmitter uses the CTS input (or RTS output in loopback mode) for flow control purposes.

field.name: CLKPOL
field.description: Selects the clock polarity and sampling edge of received data in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a slave.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Master. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a master.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPBACK
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback mode. This provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing for USART data. Serial data from the transmitter (Un_TXD) is connected internally to serial input of the receive (Un_RXD). Un_TXD and Un_RTS activity will also appear on external pins if these functions are configured to appear on device pins. The receiver RTS signal is also looped back to CTS and performs flow control if enabled by CTSEN.

field.name: OETA
field.description: Output Enable Turnaround time enable for RS-485 operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal deasserted at the end of the last stop bit of a transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal remains asserted for one character time after the end of the last stop bit of a transmission. OE will also remain asserted if another transmit begins before it is deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by software. This provides the possibility of versatile addressing (e.g. respond to more than one address).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by hardware, using the value in the ADDR register as the address to match.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RTS signal is used as the standard flow control function.

enumeratedValue.name: RS_485
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485. The RTS signal configured to provide an output enable signal to control an RS-485 transceiver.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active high.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RX signal is used as it arrives from the pin. This means that the RX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The RX signal is inverted before being used by the USART. This means that the RX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The TX signal is sent out without change. This means that the TX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The TX signal is inverted by the USART before being sent out. This means that the TX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

register.name: CTL
register.description: USART Control register. USART control settings that are more likely to change during operation.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINOUS
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous break. Continuous break is sent immediately when this bit is set, and remains until this bit is cleared. A break may be sent without danger of corrupting any currently transmitting character if the transmitter is first disabled (TXDIS in CTL is set) and then waiting for the transmitter to be disabled (TXDISINT in STAT = 1) before writing 1 to TXBRKEN.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART presents all incoming data.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART receiver ignores incoming data that does not have the most significant bit of the data (typically the 9th bit) = 1. When the data MSB bit = 1, the receiver treats the incoming data normally, generating a received data interrupt. Software can then check the data to see if this is an address that should be handled. If it is, the ADDRDET bit is cleared by software and further incoming data is handled normally.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Not disabled. USART transmitter is not disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART transmitter is disabled after any character currently being transmitted is complete. This feature can be used to facilitate software flow control.

field.name: CC
field.description: Continuous Clock generation. By default, SCLK is only output while data is being transmitted in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_ON_CHARACTER
enumeratedValue.description: Clock on character. In synchronous mode, SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on Un_TXD or to complete a character that is being received.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINOUS_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous clock. SCLK runs continuously in synchronous mode, allowing characters to be received on Un_RxD independently from transmission on Un_TXD).

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. No effect on the CC bit.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-clear. The CC bit is automatically cleared when a complete character has been received. This bit is cleared at the same time.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART is in normal operating mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. USART is in autobaud mode. This bit should only be set when the USART receiver is idle. The first start bit of RX is measured and used the update the BRG register to match the received data rate. AUTOBAUD is cleared once this process is complete, or if there is an AERR.

register.name: STAT
register.description: USART Status register. The complete status value can be read here. Writing ones clears some bits in the register. Some bits can be cleared by writing a 1 to them.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT or RXDATSTAT registers.

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: Receiver Idle. When 0, indicates that the receiver is currently in the process of receiving data. When 1, indicates that the receiver is not currently in the process of receiving data.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT. Set when the data is moved from the transmit buffer to the transmit shift register.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle. When 0, indicates that the transmitter is currently in the process of sending data.When 1, indicate that the transmitter is not currently in the process of sending data.

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit reflects the current state of the CTS signal, regardless of the setting of the CTSEN bit in the CFG register. This will be the value of the CTS input pin unless loopback mode is enabled.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state is detected for the CTS flag above. This bit is cleared by software.

field.name: TXDISSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag. When 1, this bit indicates that the USART transmitter is fully idle after being disabled via the TXDIS in the CTL register (TXDIS = 1).

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a new character is received while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the newly received character in the shift register is lost.

field.name: RXBRK
field.description: Received Break. This bit reflects the current state of the receiver break detection logic. It is set when the Un_RXD pin remains low for 16 bit times. Note that FRAMERRINT will also be set when this condition occurs because the stop bit(s) for the character would be missing. RXBRK is cleared when the Un_RXD pin goes high.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.Cleared by software.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input. Its purpose is primarily to allow wake-up from Deep-sleep or Power-down mode immediately when a start is detected. Cleared by software.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a character is received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag. Three samples of received data are taken in order to determine the value of each received data bit, except in synchronous mode. This acts as a noise filter if one sample disagrees. This flag is set when a received data bit contains one disagreeing sample. This could indicate line noise, a baud rate or character format mismatch, or loss of synchronization during data reception.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Autobaud Error. An autobaud error can occur if the BRG counts to its limit before the end of the start bit that is being measured, essentially an autobaud time-out.

field.name: RXIDLETO
field.description: RX IDLE Timeout flag. Set when the receiver has been idle for a certain period of time as specified by CTRL.RXIDLETOCFG. Writing 1 clears this bit and lowers the corresponding interrupt. Once cleared, it cannot be set again until after the receiver receives a new character (non-idle).

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set register. Contains an individual interrupt enable bit for each potential USART interrupt. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a received character available to be read from the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the TXDAT register is available to take another character to transmit.

field.name: TXIDLEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter becomes idle (TXIDLE = 1).

field.name: DELTACTSEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a change in the state of the CTS input.

field.name: TXDISEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter is fully disabled as indicated by the TXDISINT flag in STAT. See description of the TXDISINT bit for details.

field.name: OVERRUNEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an overrun error occurred.

field.name: DELTARXBRKEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a change of state has occurred in the detection of a received break condition (break condition asserted or deasserted).

field.name: STARTEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a received start bit has been detected.

field.name: FRAMERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a framing error has been detected.

field.name: PARITYERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a parity error has been detected.

field.name: RXNOISEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when noise is detected.

field.name: ABERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an autobaud error occurs.

field.name: RXIDLETOEN
field.description: RX IDLE timeout interrupt enable. Write 1 to set the bit. Writing 0 has no effect. 0: RX IDLE time out interrupt is disabled. 1: When STAT.RXIDLETO is set, interrupt is asserted.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear register. Allows clearing any combination of bits in the INTENSET register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXIDLECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: DELTACTSCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXDISINTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: OVERRUNCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: DELTARXBRKCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: STARTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: FRAMERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: PARITYERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXNOISECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: ABERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXIDLETOEN
field.description: Writing 1 to clears INTENSET[RXIDLETOEN]. Writing 0 has no effect. The access for this bit is write-only.

register.name: RXDAT
register.description: Receiver Data register. Contains the last character received.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

register.name: RXDATSTAT
register.description: Receiver Data with Status register. Combines the last character received with the current USART receive status. Allows DMA or software to recover incoming data and status together.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will set when the character in RXDAT was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

register.name: TXDAT
register.description: Transmit Data register. Data to be transmitted is written here.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Data Register causes the data to be transmitted as soon as the transmit shift register is available and any conditions for transmitting data are met: CTS low (if CTSEN bit = 1), TXDIS bit = 0.

register.name: BRG
register.description: Baud Rate Generator register. 16-bit integer baud rate divisor value.

field.name: BRGVAL
field.description: This value is used to divide the USART input clock to determine the baud rate, based on the input clock from the FRG. 0 = FCLK is used directly by the USART function. 1 = FCLK is divided by 2 before use by the USART function. 2 = FCLK is divided by 3 before use by the USART function. 0xFFFF = FCLK is divided by 65,536 before use by the USART function.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status register. Reflects interrupts that are currently enabled.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of the CTS input is detected.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input.

field.name: RXIDLETOINT
field.description: RX IDLE timeout interrupt flag. The access of this bit is read-only.

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversample selection register for asynchronous communication.

field.name: OSRVAL
field.description: Oversample Selection Value. 0 to 3 = not supported 0x4 = 5 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0x5 = 6 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0xF= 16 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit.

register.name: ADDR
register.description: Address register for automatic address matching.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: 8-bit address used with automatic address matching. Used when address detection is enabled (ADDRDET in CTL = 1) and automatic address matching is enabled (AUTOADDR in CFG = 1).

field.name: CRC_POLY
field.description: CRC polynomial: 1X = CRC-32 polynomial 01 = CRC-16 polynomial 00 = CRC-CCITT polynomial

field.name: BIT_RVS_WR
field.description: Data bit order: 1 = Bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte) 0 = No bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte)

field.name: CMPL_WR
field.description: Data complement: 1 = 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA 0 = No 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA

field.name: BIT_RVS_SUM
field.description: CRC sum bit order: 1 = Bit order reverse for CRC_SUM 0 = No bit order reverse for CRC_SUM

field.name: CMPL_SUM
field.description: CRC sum complement: 1 = 1's complement for CRC_SUM 0 = No 1's complement for CRC_SUM

field.name: CRC_SEED
field.description: A write access to this register will load CRC seed value to CRC_SUM register with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-processes. A write access to this register will overrule the CRC calculation in progresses.

field.name: CRC_SUM
field.description: The most recent CRC sum can be read through this register with selected bit order and 1's complement post-processes.

field.name: CRC_WR_DATA
field.description: Data written to this register will be taken to perform CRC calculation with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-process. Any write size 8, 16 or 32-bit are allowed and accept back-to-back transactions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The DMA controller is disabled. This clears any triggers that were asserted at the point when disabled, but does not prevent re-triggering when the DMA controller is re-enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The DMA controller is enabled.

field.name: ACTIVEINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any enabled interrupts (other than error interrupts) are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No enabled interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one enabled interrupt is pending.

field.name: ACTIVEERRINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one error interrupt is pending.

register.name: SRAMBASE
register.description: SRAM address of the channel configuration table.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Address bits 31:9 of the beginning of the DMA descriptor table. For 18 channels, the table must begin on a 512 byte boundary.

register.name: ENABLESET0
register.description: Channel Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: ENA
field.description: Enable for DMA channels. Bit n enables or disables DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

register.name: ENABLECLR0
register.description: Channel Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bits in ENABLESET0. Bit n clears the channel enable bit n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved.

register.name: ACTIVE0
register.description: Channel Active status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ACT
field.description: Active flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = not active. 1 = active.

register.name: BUSY0
register.description: Channel Busy status for all DMA channels.

field.name: BSY
field.description: Busy flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = not busy. 1 = busy.

register.name: ERRINT0
register.description: Error Interrupt status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ERR
field.description: Error Interrupt flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = error interrupt is not active. 1 = error interrupt is active.

register.name: INTENSET0
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Interrupt Enable read and set for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = interrupt for DMA channel is disabled. 1 = interrupt for DMA channel is enabled.

register.name: INTENCLR0
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears corresponding bits in the INTENSET0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved.

register.name: INTA0
register.description: Interrupt A status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IA
field.description: Interrupt A status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt A is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt A is active.

register.name: INTB0
register.description: Interrupt B status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IB
field.description: Interrupt B status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt B is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt B is active.

register.name: SETVALID0
register.description: Set ValidPending control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: SV
field.description: SETVALID control for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the VALIDPENDING control bit for DMA channel n

register.name: SETTRIG0
register.description: Set Trigger control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Set Trigger control bit for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the TRIG bit for DMA channel n.

register.name: ABORT0
register.description: Channel Abort control for all DMA channels.

field.name: ABORTCTRL
field.description: Abort control for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = no effect. 1 = aborts DMA operations on channel n.

field.name: PERIPHREQEN
field.description: Peripheral request Enable. If a DMA channel is used to perform a memory-to-memory move, any peripheral DMA request associated with that channel can be disabled to prevent any interaction between the peripheral and the DMA controller.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Peripheral DMA requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Peripheral DMA requests are enabled.

field.name: HWTRIGEN
field.description: Hardware Triggering Enable for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Hardware triggering is not used.

field.name: TRIGPOL
field.description: Trigger Polarity. Selects the polarity of a hardware trigger for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_LOW_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Active low - falling edge. Hardware trigger is active low or falling edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_HIGH_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Active high - rising edge. Hardware trigger is active high or rising edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

field.name: TRIGTYPE
field.description: Trigger Type. Selects hardware trigger as edge triggered or level triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Edge. Hardware trigger is edge triggered. Transfers will be initiated and completed, as specified for a single trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Level. Hardware trigger is level triggered. Note that when level triggering without burst (BURSTPOWER = 0) is selected, only hardware triggers should be used on that channel. Transfers continue as long as the trigger level is asserted. Once the trigger is de-asserted, the transfer will be paused until the trigger is, again, asserted. However, the transfer will not be paused until any remaining transfers within the current BURSTPOWER length are completed.

field.name: TRIGBURST
field.description: Trigger Burst. Selects whether hardware triggers cause a single or burst transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Single transfer. Hardware trigger causes a single transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: BURST
enumeratedValue.description: Burst transfer. When the trigger for this channel is set to edge triggered, a hardware trigger causes a burst transfer, as defined by BURSTPOWER. When the trigger for this channel is set to level triggered, a hardware trigger causes transfers to continue as long as the trigger is asserted, unless the transfer is complete.

field.name: BURSTPOWER
field.description: Burst Power is used in two ways. It always selects the address wrap size when SRCBURSTWRAP and/or DSTBURSTWRAP modes are selected (see descriptions elsewhere in this register). When the TRIGBURST field elsewhere in this register = 1, Burst Power selects how many transfers are performed for each DMA trigger. This can be used, for example, with peripherals that contain a FIFO that can initiate a DMA operation when the FIFO reaches a certain level. 0000: Burst size = 1 (20). 0001: Burst size = 2 (21). 0010: Burst size = 4 (22). 1010: Burst size = 1024 (210). This corresponds to the maximum supported transfer count. others: not supported. The total transfer length as defined in the XFERCOUNT bits in the XFERCFG register must be an even multiple of the burst size.

field.name: SRCBURSTWRAP
field.description: Source Burst Wrap. When enabled, the source data address for the DMA is 'wrapped', meaning that the source address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to read several sequential registers from a peripheral for each DMA burst, reading the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Source burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Source burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: DSTBURSTWRAP
field.description: Destination Burst Wrap. When enabled, the destination data address for the DMA is 'wrapped', meaning that the destination address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to write several sequential registers to a peripheral for each DMA burst, writing the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Destination burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Destination burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: CHPRIORITY
field.description: Priority of this channel when multiple DMA requests are pending. Eight priority levels are supported: 0x0 = highest priority. 0x7 = lowest priority.

register.name: CTLSTAT
register.description: Control and status register for DMA channel .

field.name: VALIDPENDING
field.description: Valid pending flag for this channel. This bit is set when a 1 is written to the corresponding bit in the related SETVALID register when CFGVALID = 1 for the same channel.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. No effect on DMA operation.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Trigger flag. Indicates that the trigger for this channel is currently set. This bit is cleared at the end of an entire transfer or upon reload when CLRTRIG = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Not triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is not set. DMA operations will not be carried out.

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is set. DMA operations will be carried out.

register.name: XFERCFG
register.description: Transfer configuration register for DMA channel .

field.name: CFGVALID
field.description: Configuration Valid flag. This bit indicates whether the current channel descriptor is valid and can potentially be acted upon, if all other activation criteria are fulfilled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Not valid. The channel descriptor is not considered valid until validated by an associated SETVALID0 setting.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Valid. The current channel descriptor is considered valid.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Indicates whether the channel's control structure will be reloaded when the current descriptor is exhausted. Reloading allows ping-pong and linked transfers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Do not reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Not set. When written by software, the trigger for this channel is not set. A new trigger, as defined by the HWTRIGEN, TRIGPOL, and TRIGTYPE will be needed to start the channel.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. When written by software, the trigger for this channel is set immediately. This feature should not be used with level triggering when TRIGBURST = 0.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Not cleared. The trigger is not cleared when this descriptor is exhausted. If there is a reload, the next descriptor will be started.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Cleared. The trigger is cleared when this descriptor is exhausted

field.name: SETINTA
field.description: Set Interrupt flag A for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTA flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SETINTB
field.description: Set Interrupt flag B for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTB flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: WIDTH
field.description: Transfer width used for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_8
enumeratedValue.description: 8-bit. 8-bit transfers are performed (8-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_16
enumeratedValue.description: 16-bit. 6-bit transfers are performed (16-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_32
enumeratedValue.description: 32-bit. 32-bit transfers are performed (32-bit source reads and destination writes).

field.name: SRCINC
field.description: Determines whether the source address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The source address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The source address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The source address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The source address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: DSTINC
field.description: Determines whether the destination address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The destination address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The destination address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The destination address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The destination address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: XFERCOUNT
field.description: Total number of transfers to be performed, minus 1 encoded. The number of bytes transferred is: (XFERCOUNT + 1) x data width (as defined by the WIDTH field). The DMA controller uses this bit field during transfer to count down. Hence, it cannot be used by software to read back the size of the transfer, for instance, in an interrupt handler. 0x0 = a total of 1 transfer will be performed. 0x1 = a total of 2 transfers will be performed. 0x3FF = a total of 1,024 transfers will be performed.

enumeratedValue.name: CLKS_noclock
enumeratedValue.description: No clock selected. This in effect disables the FTM counter.

enumeratedValue.name: CPWMS_upcount
enumeratedValue.description: FTM counter operates in Up Counting mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CPWMS_updowncount
enumeratedValue.description: FTM counter operates in Up-Down Counting mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RF_no
enumeratedValue.description: A selected reload point did not happen.

enumeratedValue.name: TOIE_disabletof
enumeratedValue.description: Disable TOF interrupts. Use software polling.

enumeratedValue.name: TOIE_enabletof
enumeratedValue.description: Enable TOF interrupts. An interrupt is generated when TOF equals one.

enumeratedValue.description: FTM counter is not reset when the selected channel (n) input event is detected.

enumeratedValue.name: ICRST_reset
enumeratedValue.description: FTM counter is reset when the selected channel (n) input event is detected.

enumeratedValue.name: CHIE_disable
enumeratedValue.description: Disable channel (n) interrupt. Use software polling.

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGMODE_normal
enumeratedValue.description: Channel outputs will generate the normal PWM outputs without generating a pulse.

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGMODE_trigger
enumeratedValue.description: If a match in the channel occurs, a trigger generation on channel output will happen. The trigger pulse width has one FTM clock cycle.

enumeratedValue.description: TPM compatibility. Free running counter and synchronization compatible with TPM.

enumeratedValue.name: FTMEN_compatible_no
enumeratedValue.description: Free running counter and synchronization are different from TPM behavior.

enumeratedValue.name: PWMSYNC_restrict_no
enumeratedValue.description: No restrictions. Software and hardware triggers can be used by MOD, CnV, OUTMASK, and FTM counter synchronization.

enumeratedValue.name: PWMSYNC_restrict_yes
enumeratedValue.description: Software trigger can only be used by MOD and CnV synchronization, and hardware triggers can only be used by OUTMASK and FTM counter synchronization.

enumeratedValue.name: FAULTM_enabled_auto

field.name: TOFDIR
field.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

enumeratedValue.name: TOFDIR_bottom
enumeratedValue.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

enumeratedValue.name: TOFDIR_top
enumeratedValue.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

enumeratedValue.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

enumeratedValue.name: QUADMODE_aandb
enumeratedValue.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.
